classes

Class Artifical_Intelligence

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Storage
      • classes.Artifical_Intelligence

  • public class Artifical_Intelligence
extends Storage
    This class is an artificial intelligence class. According to level of difficulty,it calculates all possibilities and selects the best move from calculations. It uses eight different methods checkMyMoves(),checkEnemyMoves(), cleverMoveOne(), defanseOne(),cleverMoveTwo(), defanseTwo(), cleverMoveThree(), defanseThree() and five different calculation methods calculateResultsMoveTwo(), calculateResultsMoveThree(), calculateResultDefanceOne(), calculateResultDefanceTwo(), calculateResultsForDefanceThree().
    Author:
    Mert SOLAK, Onur ELGÜN
    See Also:
    Collections, Arrays

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Artifical_Intelligence()
      This is a default constructor.
      Artifical_Intelligence(PlayingPage p)
      This is a parametric constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean calculateResultDefanceOne()
      This method selects the best move from data which came from defanseOne() in @param result[] and decide to whether play or not.
      boolean calculateResultDefanceTwo()
      This method selects the best move from data which came from defanseTwo() in @param result[] and decide to whether play or not.
      boolean calculateResultsDefanceThree()
      This method selects the best move from data which came from defanceThree() in @param result[] and decide to whether play or not.
      boolean calculateResultsMoveThree()
      This method selects the best move from data which came from cleverMoveThree() in @param result[] and decide to whether play or not.
      boolean calculateResultsMoveTwo()
      This method selects the best move from data which came from cleverMoveTwo() in @param result[] and decide to whether play or not.
      boolean checkEnemyMoves(boolean flag)
      This method calculates if there are two moves in same line or cross and if the flag is true, method makes a move if the flag is false, it assigns result to @param vertical[], horizontal[] and cross[] parameters for user.
      int checkMyForDefanse()
      This method calculates if there are two moves in same line or cross and if the flag is true, method makes a move and returns place which is made move by put().
      boolean checkMyMoves(boolean flag)
      This method calculates if there are two moves in same line or cross and if the flag is true, method makes a move if the flag is false, it assigns result to @param vertical[], horizontal[] and cross[] parameters for computer.
      boolean cleverMoveOne()
      This method looks one move forward to calculate possible pair dangers from computer and decides to make a move or not.
      boolean cleverMoveThree()
      This method looks three moves forward to calculate possible pair dangers from computer and assign them to @param result[].
      boolean cleverMoveTwo()
      This method looks two moves forward to calculate possible pair dangers from computer and assign them to @param result[].
      boolean defanceThree()
      This method looks three moves forward to calculate possible pair dangers from user and assign them to @param result[].
      boolean defanseOne()
      This method looks one move forward to calculate possible pair dangers from user and assign them to @param result[].
      boolean defanseTwo()
      This method looks two moves forward to calculate possible pair dangers from user and assign them to @param result[].
      void fillResult(int i)
      This method assigns given integers to @param result[].
      int getFifthMove() 
      int getFirstMove() 
      int getFourthMove() 
      int getHardness() 
      int getSecondMove() 
      int getSixthMove() 
      int getThirdMove() 
      void play()
      This method arranges methods checkMyMoves(), checkEnemyMoves(), cleverMoveOne(), defanseOne(), cleverMoveTwo(), defanseTwo(), cleverMoveThree(), defanceThree() to create optimal move according to level of difficulty.
      void resetLine(int i)
      This method uses setMethods() in playing page class to set them empty.

      void setFirstMove(int i) 
      void setFourthMove(int i) 
      void setHardness(int i) 
      void setSecondMove(int i) 
      void setSixthMove(int i)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Artifical_Intelligence

        public Artifical_Intelligence()
        This is a default constructor. It reserves places in memory for variables.

      • Artifical_Intelligence

        public Artifical_Intelligence(PlayingPage p)
        This is a parametric constructor. It reserves places in memory for variables and takes playing page object to check the level of difficulty and to control playing page JFrame.
        Parameters:
        p - and pObject are the playing page objects.

      • play

        public void play()
        This method arranges methods checkMyMoves(), checkEnemyMoves(), cleverMoveOne(), defanseOne(), cleverMoveTwo(), defanseTwo(), cleverMoveThree(), defanceThree() to create optimal move according to level of difficulty.
